text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Game.com is a portable console designed by Tiger Electronics in 1997. It is equipped with a Sharp SM8521 8-bit processor and offers mono PCM sound as well as FM functions. The monochrome screen in 4 shades of gray displays a resolution of 200x160 pixels. Aimed at an older audience, it offered several new ideas. Equipped with a touch screen and a stylus, it could act as a personal assistant. The first version of the console could, via its second cartridge port, be connected to a 14.4 kbit/s modem to read its emails.
